story: Khaled Ramadan shared ITPharaohs's post to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: ITPharaohs
description:
V.I.
We do NOT recommend JavaScript libraries use Bower. Bower places additional burdens on JavaScript package authors for little to no gain. npmcdn is intended to make it easier to publish code, not harder, so Bower support will be removed in January 2017. Please move to npm for installing packages and stop using Bower before that time.

data.message:
I tried reading it several times but the sentence doesn't make any sense. Which support will be removed on Jan 2017? There is no official statments from bower. All the links I can found are kinda speculations linking to an old comments thread on github (https://github.com/bower/bower/pull/1748#issuecomment-150104311) ITPharaohs website doesn't say they are contributing by  any mean to the open source community and they are remove their *packages* bower.
I would like to hear your point
